message.content: A merism is a figure of speech in which a word or phrase that usually signifies completeness, such as "whole," "entire," or "all," is repeated to emphasize the extent or completeness of something being described. For example, "from head to toe" is a merism used to mean "completely from one end to the other." Other examples include "top to bottom," "beginning to end," and "inside out." Merisms are often used in poetry and literature to create vivid imagery and emphasize the magnitude of an object, action, or emotion.
